00022 #include <GisCommon.h>
00023 
00024 /// \brief
00025 /// GisXslTransformer provides a way to execute an XSL stylesheet
00026 /// on an XML document.
00027 class GisXslTransformer : public GisDisposable
00028 {
00029 public:
00030 
00031     /// \brief
00032     /// Constructs an XSL Transformer object.
00033     /// 
00034     /// \param inDoc 
00035     /// Input the XML document to transform.
00036     /// \param stylesheet 
00037     /// Input the XSL stylesheet with transformation instructions.
00038     /// \param outDoc 
00039     /// Output the transformed XML document.
00040     /// \warning 
00041     /// The transformed document is not completely written until 'outDoc'
00042     /// and this transformer are destroyed by releasing all references to them.
00043     /// Therefore, these objects must be destroyed before reading back the 
00044     /// transformed document.
00045     /// \param log 
00046     /// Input the logging object which captures messages and warnings.
00047     /// 
00048     /// \return
00049     /// Returns GisXslTransformer
00050     /// 
00051     GIS_API static GisXslTransformer* Create( 
00052         GisXmlReader* inDoc = NULL, 
00053         GisXmlReader* stylesheet = NULL, 
00054         GisXmlWriter* outDoc = NULL,
00055         GisIoTextWriter* log = NULL
00056     );
00057 
00058     /// \brief
00059     /// Gets the document being transformed
00060     /// 
00061     /// \return
00062     /// Returns the input document.
00063     /// 
00064     GIS_API GisXmlReader* GetInDoc();
00065 
00066     /// \brief
00067     /// Sets the document to transform.
00068     /// 
00069     /// \param inDoc 
00070     /// Input the XML document to transform.
00071     /// 
00072     GIS_API void SetInDoc( GisXmlReader* inDoc );
00073 
00074     /// \brief
00075     /// Gets the XSL Stylesheet
00076     /// 
00077     /// \return
00078     /// Returns the stylesheet.
00079     /// 
00080     GIS_API GisXmlReader* GetStylesheet();
00081 
00082     /// \brief
00083     /// Sets the XSL stylesheet
00084     /// 
00085     /// \param stylesheet 
00086     /// Input the stylesheet
00087     /// 
00088     GIS_API void SetStylesheet( GisXmlReader* stylesheet );
00089 
00090     /// \brief
00091     /// Gets the output document.
00092     /// 
00093     /// \return
00094     /// Returns the out document
00095     /// 
00096     GIS_API GisXmlWriter* GetOutDoc();
00097 
00098     /// \brief
00099     /// Sets the output document
00100     /// 
00101     /// \param outDoc 
00102     /// Input the output document
00103     /// \warning 
00104     /// The output document is not completely written until outDoc
00105     /// and this transformer are destroyed by releasing all references to them.
00106     /// 
00107     GIS_API void SetOutDoc( GisXmlWriter* outDoc );
00108 
00109     /// \brief
00110     /// Gets the logging object
00111     /// 
00112     /// \return
00113     /// Returns the logging object
00114     /// 
00115     GIS_API GisIoTextWriter* GetLog();
00116 
00117     /// \brief
00118     /// Sets the logging object
00119     /// 
00120     /// \param log 
00121     /// The logging object which captures messages and warnings.
00122     /// 
00123     GIS_API void SetLog( GisIoTextWriter* log );
00124 
00125     /// \brief
00126     /// Gets the list of parameters that will be passed to the 
00127     /// stylesheet by Transform(). The caller can add parameters to this list
00128     /// or modify/delete existing parameters. The parameter list is empty
00129     /// when this class is constructed.
00130     /// Parameter values must be in XPath syntax. Therefore, literal values
00131     /// must be enclosed in single quotes.
00132     /// 
00133     /// \return
00134     /// Returns the parameter list.
00135     /// 
00136     GIS_API GisDictionary* GetParameters();
00137 
00138     /// \brief
00139     /// Performs the transformation.
00140     /// 
00141     GIS_API virtual void Transform() = 0;
00142 
00143 protected:
00144 /// \cond DOXYGEN-IGNORE
00145     GisXslTransformer( 
00146         GisXmlReader* inDoc = NULL, 
00147         GisXmlReader* stylesheet = NULL, 
00148         GisXmlWriter* outDoc = NULL,
00149         GisIoTextWriter* log = NULL
00150     );
00151 
00152     virtual ~GisXslTransformer(void) {}
00153 /// \endcond
00154 
00155 private:
00156     /// in document
00157     GisXmlReaderP mInDoc;
00158     /// stylesheet
00159     GisXmlReaderP mStylesheet;
00160     /// out document
00161     GisXmlWriterP mOutDoc;
00162     /// stylesheet parameters
00163     GisDictionaryP mParameters;
00164     /// Logger
00165     GisIoTextWriterP mLog;
00166 };
00167 
00168 /// \brief
00169 /// GisXslTransformerP is a GisPtr on GisXslTransformer, provided for convenience.
00170 typedef GisPtr<GisXslTransformer> GisXslTransformerP;
00171 
00172 #endif
